page.title: 15THE FORRESTERS' ARMS
page.content: The Forresters's Arms has always been a public house. A while ago a man called Tom Rolfe used to run the pub; they named a street after him {Rolfe Crescent}. There used to be a garden in the front of the pub and at the back there were four cottages; Mrs Fortna used to live in one of the cottages and she always used to wear a cap - a white one on the weekdays and a cream one at the weekends. Now the garden is at the back of the pub and the cottges have been demolished. During the war a 14 year old evacuee was killed after falling on the spiked railing outside the pub. Last year my parents took over the pub from my grandparents. We sell about 250 gallons of beer a week and we do snacks. In the summer we are going to do children's cocktails; the children will be safe in the garden while their parents are in the pub.
